edu.rit.m2mp.packet
Class OutgoingPacket

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.rit.m2mp.packet.Packet
        |
        +--edu.rit.m2mp.packet.OutgoingPacket
public class OutgoingPacket
extends Packet

Class OutgoingPacket encapsulates an outgoing packet in the Many-to-Many Protocol (M2MP).

To transmit a packet:

  1. Call PacketPool.allocateOutgoingPacket() to get an outgoing packet object.
  2. Call setMessageID().
  3. Call setFragmentNumber().
  4. Call reset().
  5. Call write() to write the message contents. Call getAvailable() to check how many bytes there’s still room to write.
  6. Call setLastPacket() if this is the last packet of a message.
  7. Call setChecksum().
  8. Call getBuffer() and getBufferLength() to get the filled-in packet’s byte buffer and length, respectively. Pass these to the underlying network layer to transmit the packet.
  9. When done using the packet, call PacketPool.release().

Warning: Class OutgoingPacket is not multiple thread safe.

M2MP Library Version 02-Jul-2002

          Resets this packet to start writing again from the beginning.

Method Detail

setMessageID

public void setMessageID(int theMessageID)
Sets this packet’s message ID field.

Parameters:
theMessageID - Message ID.

setFragmentNumber

public void setFragmentNumber(int theFragmentNumber)
Sets this packet’s fragment number field. The last-packet flag is set to 0.

Parameters:
theFragmentNumber - Fragment number.

reset

public void reset()
Resets this packet to start writing again from the beginning. Also makes the maximum number of bytes (498) available to be written.

Overrides:
reset in class Packet

write

public void write(int b)
Writes a byte to this packet. Assumes this packet has room for one byte.

Parameters:
b - Value to write. The least significant 8 bits are written.

write

public void write(byte[] b,
                  int off,
                  int len)
Writes a portion of a byte array to this packet. Assumes this packet has room for len bytes.

Parameters:
b - Byte array to write.
off - Index of first byte in b to write.
len - Number of bytes to write.

setLastPacket

public void setLastPacket()
Sets this packet’s last-packet flag to 1.

setChecksum

public void setChecksum()
Sets this packet’s checksum field to the proper value based on the contents of the rest of the packet. Also sets this packet’s buffer length to include just the bytes up to and including the checksum.
